title: Understanding Services and Dependency Injection in Angular
desc: Angular distinguishes components from services to increase modularity and reusability. By separating a component's view-related functionality from other kinds of processing, you can make your component classes lean and efficient.

title: Angular for Beginners: Angular Services Tutorial
desc: In this Angular services tutorial for beginners, you will learn what a service is and how to create one as well as how to use your Angular service inside of an Angular component. We will be going over how to generate a service from the Angular CLI and also how to connect our Angular service to an api in order to retrieve data.

title: How to debug Angular app using Chrome and Angular DevTools extension

title: Angular Pipes Simplified
desc:
If you have been working with Angular, then you must have heard and used the pipes. Today, in this tutorial, we will be simplifying what pipes are, why they should be used and how they should be used.

title: Getting to know the ENVIRONMENT_INITIALIZER Injection Token in Angular
desc: The environment injector is a generalized version of NgModuleRef, which is also known as the 'module injector'. It's one of the primitives required to support standalone components APIs introduced in Angular v14.

title: #6 Angular Belgrade Meetup - Emma Twersky and Muhammad Awais
desc:
TALK 1: You've read the RFCs and seen the PRs merging, get ready to 'ng update' to v14! In this talk, Emma from the Angular team will give a sneak peek into everything you can expect from Angular v14!

TALK 2: Auxiliary Routes are independent, secondary routes that can be added to a page along with a primary route. As an example, we can have a side-menu that lives within the primary route with its own router-outlet. In this session, we will take a look at its implementation.

Introduction to APP_INITIALIZER DI Token
desc: APP_INITIALIZER is a dependency injection token that we can use to provide one or more functions. These functions will be injected at application startup time and get executed during app initialization. For any async function returning promise will be resolved first and only after fully resolving those the app will initialize.
